item.description:
Dear Enthusiastic Boston Volunteers,

Here is a good opportunity to volunteer at community servings to  prepare and package nutritious meals for the individuals and families with critical illness. Community Servings is located at 18 Marbury Terrace in Jamaica Plain,  few minutes walk from the Stone Brook on the MBTA orange line. From Orange line-take a left onto Boylston Street, then left onto Amory Street and left onto Marbury Terrace.

If you are driving, there is a small parking lot for volunteer use on a first come first serve basis. Also, up-to 4 people can ride with me if its on my way or in a feasible location.

Address:   Community Servings-18 Marbury Terrace in Jamaica Plain

Date/Time: 18-Dec-12, Tuesday 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM

Dress Code: Comfortable clothes (Pants or long skirts) and shoes.

My sincere request to all the volunteers:

  • A firm commitment  to the event considering the weekday.
  • Pants or long skirts and shoes are required to meet the safety and sanitation requirements.
  • Please co-ordinate with me at-least a  day in advance if you don't have any means of transportation. We can work something out.
  • Dont hesitate to contact me for additional information regarding this event.

Let's go folks, just 2 hrs of your time will help maintain health and dignity and preserve the integrity of many families in MA. Also, a good opportunity to meet your fellow Boston'ians. See you all there.

The Boston Volunteers
Big Enough to Deliver, Small Enough to Care
Learn more: www.BostonVolunteer.org


Connect with your fellow Boston Volunteers
http://www.facebook.com/BostonVolunteers
Discover exclusive Boston Volunteer opportunities:
https://twitter.com/#!/BostonVolunteer

group.name: Boston Volunteers. Big enough 2 deliver, small enough 2 care

item.name: Community Servings-Jamaica Plain, MA
